oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: The New Digital Bleek and Lloyd
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: |han=kass'o (Klein Jantje) (VIII)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A reed necklace employed as a remedy for a little child suffering from a cold (L VIII.-21. 7826 and 7827). The women break and burn pieces of reed in the fire. 1) |han=kass'o observed this practice himself, 2) p.7826v: see The power of cutting possessed by the reed and quartz, 3) This story is found in Book VIII-21.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A necklace of reed used to cure a little child's cold
